message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS 

This paper is likely to belong to the cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) sub-category as it focuses on detecting malicious accounts at Alipay, a mobile cashless payment platform. It also uses graph neural networks to learn discriminative embeddings from heterogeneous account-device graphs, which is a common technique in security research. 

It could also belong to cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) as it deals with a heterogeneous graph consisting of various types of nodes. 

cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another likely sub-category as the paper proposes an attention mechanism and uses the sum operator for modeling the aggregation patterns of nodes, which are common techniques in machine learning. 

cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a possible sub-category as the paper uses graph neural networks, which is a subfield of AI, to detect malicious accounts. 

Finally, cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is a possible sub-category as the paper deals with graph-based data structures and proposes a novel approach for detecting malicious accounts based on connected subgraphs.
